prompt:
Create 4 prompts for a cohesive, chronologically flowing congratulations greeting card that tells a visual story (9:16 ratio):

ðŸŽ¨ CREATIVITY MANDATE: Be genuinely creative, unique, and innovative! Avoid generic or clichÃ© designs. Think outside the box, surprise with unexpected elements, use bold artistic choices, and create something truly memorable and special. Push creative boundaries while staying appropriate for the card type and tone.

Theme: "Fructful energized and learned a lot "
Style: ðŸŽ­ Pop Art
Tone: ðŸŽ‰ Playful - fun and energetic
To: Sissi
From: AI for Good Institute at Stanford University 
Message: "Sissi, you absolutely crushed it! Your energy was so contagious, and it was incredible to watch you grow and learn so much. We're feeling totally energized by everything you accomplished!

Huge congratulations from your biggest fans,
The AI for Good Institute at Stanford University"

Reference: "artistic transformation"

CRITICAL: Create a cohesive visual narrative that flows chronologically through the card experience:
1. FRONT COVER: First impression - sets the scene/introduces the story
2. INTERIOR SPREAD: The heart of the experience - continuation and climax of the visual story
3. BACK COVER: Conclusion - peaceful resolution or complementary ending

Requirements:
- Flat 2D artwork for printing (not 3D card images)
- Full-bleed backgrounds extending to edges
- IMPORTANT: Keep text, faces, and key elements at least 10% away from top/bottom edges (small amount may be cropped in printing)
- Keep text/faces 0.5" from left/right edges for safe printing
- CONSISTENT visual elements throughout: same characters, color palette, lighting, art style
- Progressive visual storytelling from front â†’ interior â†’ back
- Put any text in quotes and make it clear/readable
- Each section should feel like part of the same artistic universe
- TONE: Ensure the visual mood and atmosphere matches the fun and energetic tone throughout all sections
- INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY SAFETY: If the user mentions specific characters, brands, logos, or products, automatically replace them with original generic alternatives in your prompts. For example: replace specific character names with "cartoon mouse character" or "superhero character", replace brand names with "colorful cereal" or "sports car", etc. Create inspired-by designs that capture the essence without referencing any protected names or specific copyrighted elements. Never include actual brand names, character names, or trademarked terms in the image generation prompts
- CONTENT SAFETY: Ensure all prompts are family-friendly and appropriate for greeting cards. Avoid any content that could be flagged by safety systems including: violence, weapons, inappropriate imagery, political content, controversial topics, scary or disturbing elements, or anything not suitable for all ages. If the user requests something potentially inappropriate, redirect to positive, wholesome alternatives that capture their intent in a family-friendly way




- Include bright colors, dynamic poses, and energetic visual elements

- Create cartoon/illustrated characters inspired by reference image - DO NOT make realistic depictions

Create prompts that flow chronologically:

1. Front Cover (Opening Scene): BE GENUINELY CREATIVE AND UNIQUE! Include "congratulations" greeting text positioned safely in the center area (avoid top/bottom 10% of image). TEXT STYLE: Write the greeting text in beautiful, clearly readable handwritten cursive script that matches the elegant style used inside the card - legible, flowing, and graceful with natural character and warmth. I have included my own reference image. Create a stylized cartoon/illustrated character inspired by the reference image - DO NOT make realistic depictions of real people, instead create charming cartoon-style characters with simplified, friendly features. This is the story opening - introduce key visual elements (colors, motifs, artistic style) that will continue throughout the other sections. Think of something unexpected, innovative, and memorable that will surprise and delight the recipient. Avoid generic designs! Style: in pop art style like Andy Warhol and Roy Lichtenstein, with bold colors, comic book elements, halftone dots, and graphic design aesthetics

2. Left Interior (Story Development): UNLEASH YOUR CREATIVITY! You have complete creative freedom to design whatever you want for this left interior page! This is your artistic playground - create something genuinely innovative and unexpected that feels right for a congratulations card with fun and energetic tone. You can include: scenes, landscapes, objects, patterns, quotes, text, illustrations, realistic art, abstract art, or anything else that inspires you - but NO PEOPLE or characters unless the user specifically mentioned wanting people in their card description. Position any text safely in center area (avoid top/bottom 10%). Think of something no one has done before! Surprise us with bold, imaginative, and memorable artistic choices while maintaining visual harmony with the overall card style and tone. Style: in pop art style like Andy Warhol and Roy Lichtenstein, with bold colors, comic book elements, halftone dots, and graphic design aesthetics

3. Right Interior (Story Climax): BE CREATIVE WITH MESSAGE DESIGN! Include message text: "Sissi, you absolutely crushed it! Your energy was so contagious, and it was incredible to watch you grow and learn so much. We're feeling totally energized by everything you accomplished!

Huge congratulations from your biggest fans,
The AI for Good Institute at Stanford University" positioned safely in center area (avoid top/bottom 10% of image) integrated into beautiful, innovative decorative artwork. HANDWRITING STYLE: Write the message in beautiful, clearly readable handwritten cursive script that feels elegant and personal. The handwriting should be legible, flowing, and have natural character - not overly perfect but graceful and warm. Use a nice pen-style appearance with natural ink flow and slight variations in line weight. Think of sophisticated calligraphy that's still approachable and easy to read. Make the handwriting feel genuine and heartfelt. Think beyond typical florals and patterns - create something unexpected and artistic that perfectly frames the handwritten message - NO PEOPLE or characters. This should feel like the emotional peak of the card experience, harmonizing with the left interior as a cohesive spread. Avoid clichÃ© designs and create something genuinely special! Use the elegant cursive handwriting style described above. Style: in pop art style like Andy Warhol and Roy Lichtenstein, with bold colors, comic book elements, halftone dots, and graphic design aesthetics

4. Back Cover (Story Resolution): BE SUBTLY CREATIVE! Create a simple yet innovative decorative design that brings peaceful closure to the visual story. Reference subtle elements from the front cover but keep it minimal and serene - NO PEOPLE, just beautiful, unexpected artistic elements that go beyond typical patterns or florals. IMPORTANT: Leave the bottom-right corner area (approximately 1 inch square) completely clear and undecorated - this space is reserved for a QR code. Focus decorative elements toward the center and left side of the design. Think of something quietly beautiful and memorable that complements the overall design while being genuinely unique. This should feel like a peaceful, artistic ending that surprises with its subtle creativity. Style: in pop art style like Andy Warhol and Roy Lichtenstein, with bold colors, comic book elements, halftone dots, and graphic design aesthetics

VISUAL CONTINUITY CHECKLIST:
- Same color palette across all sections
- Consistent lighting/time of day
- Same artistic techniques and brushwork
- Recurring visual motifs or symbols (but make them unique and memorable!)
- Progressive emotional journey from introduction to resolution
- Front cover: stylized cartoon/illustrated characters if people are needed for the theme
- Left interior: CREATIVE FREEDOM but NO PEOPLE unless user specifically requested people in their description
- Right interior: focus on message space with innovative decorative elements (NO PEOPLE)
- Back cover: simple yet creative decorative design without text or people
- Use simplified, friendly, charming character design if including people (front cover only)
- CREATIVITY PRIORITY: Always choose the more innovative, surprising, and memorable option over generic designs

Return JSON:
{
  "frontCover": "detailed prompt with story opening elements",
  "backCover": "detailed prompt with story conclusion elements",
  "leftInterior": "detailed prompt with story development elements",
  "rightInterior": "detailed prompt with story climax elements"
}

IMPORTANT: Create a completely unique and different interpretation for this specific card variant. Use different creative approaches, color schemes, compositions, and artistic elements while maintaining the same core theme and requirements.

generatedPrompts.frontCover:
Front cover of a greeting card with a bold Pop Art style, inspired by Roy Lichtenstein and Andy Warhol. The artwork features a stylized, comic-book illustration of a woman with vibrant blonde, curly hair, large expressive eyes, and bright red lips. She is wearing large headphones and a chunky silver chain necklace. A bright yellow lightbulb with emanating rays signifies an idea or accomplishment. Musical notes and binary code (1010101010) are depicted as flowing around her head, suggesting the "learned a lot" theme. The text "Congratulations" is rendered in a dynamic, starburst-shaped speech bubble, colored in a contrasting yellow with a black outline, and filled with a clear, elegant cursive font. The background is a split design: the upper portion is a bright blue with musical notes and a subtle circular pattern, while the lower portion is a peach color with a halftone dot pattern. The overall color palette is vibrant and energetic, with strong contrasts between yellow, blue, peach, and black. The composition is dynamic, with the character positioned slightly off-center, drawing the viewer's eye towards the "Congratulations" text and the lightbulb. The mood is playful, celebratory, and intellectually stimulating, perfectly capturing the "fructful energized and learned a lot" theme. The illustration style is flat 2D, with bold black outlines and distinct color blocking.

Musical notes and sequences of binary code \"1010101010\" are scattered around her, conveying the \"learned a lot\" aspect of the theme. The central focus is a bright yellow, starburst-shaped speech bubble containing the word \"Congratulations\" in a beautiful, legible, flowing cursive script. The background is divided into two distinct areas: the top half is a bright blue with subtle circular patterns and scattered musical notes, while the bottom half is a peach color with a classic halftone dot pattern. The color palette is bold and energetic, dominated by yellow, blue, peach, black, and white. The overall mood is playful, celebratory, and conveys intellectual stimulation, aligning with the theme of \"fructful energized and learned a lot.\"",

The decorative elements are concentrated towards the center and left side of the full-bleed background, leaving the bottom-right corner completely clear for a QR code. There are no people, text, or prominent characters. The mood is one of peaceful resolution and subtle, unexpected artistic closure, complementing the overall celebratory yet learned tone of the card.",

The design avoids clichÃ©s, offering a unique and memorable artistic backdrop that emphasizes the celebratory message and the \"fructful energized and learned a lot\" theme. There are no people or characters present in this section."
```json
}
```
generatedPrompts.backCover:
Back cover design for a greeting card with a bright pink, full-bleed background. A subtle, faded pattern of small pink dots overlays the background, consistent with a pop art halftone effect. In the upper-center area, there are three small, thin yellow lines radiating outwards from an unseen point, suggesting light or energy, similar to the front cover's lightbulb illustration but greatly simplified and abstracted. No text, faces, or prominent graphical elements are present. The design is minimal and serene, providing a clean and peaceful resolution that subtly echoes the "idea" motif from the front. The bottom-right corner, approximately one inch square, is left completely clear and undecorated to accommodate a QR code. The overall aesthetic maintains a playful and energetic tone through its bold color choice and the subtle pop art texture.

generatedPrompts.leftInterior: Left interior page of a greeting card with a vibrant Pop Art style, reminiscent of Andy Warhol and Roy Lichtenstein. The background is a dynamic explosion of bright, contrasting colors: hot pink, electric blue, and sunny yellow, arranged in sharp, angular rays that create a sense of energetic movement. Overlaying this energetic background is a dense pattern of tiny, contrasting halftone dots, adding a classic comic book texture. Prominently featured are stylized, simplified graphic elements: two closed books with cream-colored pages and blue covers, and an open book with cream pages. Interspersed are bold, yellow exclamation points and a large, bright blue question mark. Dominating the composition are two stylized brain illustrations in a vivid pink, with intricate black linework representing neural pathways, one larger and more detailed, the other smaller and more abstract, appearing to sprout from a blue base. The overall effect is a visually stimulating, playful, and intellectually stimulating scene, perfectly embodying the theme of learning and energized growth. The 9:16 ratio is maintained.
generatedPrompts.rightInterior: Right interior page of a greeting card designed for message space with a Pop Art style, inspired by the works of Andy Warhol and Roy Lichtenstein. The page features a cream-colored, open book with a black outline, holding the message: "Sissi, you absolutely crushed it! Your energy was so contagious, and it was incredible to watch you grow and learn so much. We're feeling totally energized by everything you accomplished! Huge congratulations from your biggest fans, The AI for Good Institute at Stanford University". The handwriting is in a flowing, elegant, and slightly varied cursive script, resembling a smooth ink pen. The background of the entire card is a vibrant, bright yellow with a subtle halftone dot pattern, creating a playful and energetic atmosphere. The left side of the open book is filled with large, bold, yellow binary code (sequences of 0s and 1s) against a dark teal background with a faint halftone dot pattern, creating a striking visual contrast. The overall composition is flat, 2D, and designed for full-bleed printing. The core visual theme is a representation of knowledge and digital learning, conveyed through the open book and binary code, with the message text seamlessly integrated. The color palette is dominated by bright yellow, teal, black, and cream, evoking a sense of excitement and achievement. The visual storytelling is continued from the front cover, which likely featured a similar aesthetic of an open book or binary code. The tone is consistently playful and energetic, suitable for a congratulatory message.
